senses.sense_definition: Действительное причастие прошедшего времени от глагола <w>загнать</w>.

examples.text: Охотник, <загнавший> волка в ловушку, осторожно приблизился к яме.

target_lang_translations.en: The hunter, who had <driven> the wolf into a trap, cautiously approached the pit.

examples.text: Спортсмен, <загнавший> себя постоянными тренировками, решил сделать перерыв.

target_lang_translations.en: The athlete, who had <exhausted> himself with constant training, decided to take a break.

examples.text: Этот вопрос, <загнавший> студента в тупик, оказался самым сложным на экзамене.

target_lang_translations.en: This question, which had <driven> the student into a dead end, turned out to be the most difficult on the exam.

target_lang_definitions.en: Past active participle of the verb 'to drive' (into), 'to corner', or 'to exhaust'. It describes a subject that has forced someone or something into a specific place, state, or condition.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: relative clause indicating the subject performed the action of driving or forcing
participle phrase indicating the completed action
specifically when forcing into a corner or difficult situation
when referring to wearing oneself or others out physically
